title: Crafting Interpreters
description: Currently reading the textbook Crafting Interpreters by Robert Nystrom, so learning how interpreters work (via parsing, tokenizing, context-free grammars, etc.). So, I am building an interpreter through Java for Nystrom's fake programming language Lox, and in the future, using C.

title: Shaders
description: In Summer of 2024, I learned from thebookofshaders.com how to design and code shaders using OpenGL, using techniques like shaping functions, deterministic randomness, cellular noise, and fractal Brownian motion. I programmed Voronoi diagrams, the Mandelbrot set, and various cool-looking motions. Click on the shaders to cycle through some of the ones I made (and try moving your mouse over some!).
